image.altText: Victoria Police outside Flinders Street Station

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has pledged to introduce a raft of new restrictions on protesters, including banning protests from being held near places of worship.

title.children: Victoria unveils ban on protester face masks, locks and glue

image.altText: A collage of pictures of a young boy with brown hair, some with family members.

props.synopsis: Heartbroken relatives are paying tribute to an "inquisitive, car-loving" 10-year-old Victorian boy who died in a car boot during a game of hide-and-seek on Sunday.Â

title.children: Family says 'inquisitive' boy who died in car boot was playing 'hide and seek'

image.altText: Jacinta Allan and Tim Pallas walk in front of cameras

props.synopsis: As Victoria's Treasurer Tim Pallas steps down after a decade in the job, economists say he leaves a legacy of increased infrastructure spending and a tough task for his successor, who is yet to be announced.

title.children: How has Tim Pallas's decade as treasurer changed Victoria's fortunes?

image.altText: a truck parked in front of the fires

props.synopsis: A bushfire continues to burn in central Victoria after igniting in high temperatures and winds yesterday, while a new fire has started in the state's south-west, triggering a watch and act warning today.

title.children: Campers recount fleeing Victorian blaze, as new fire ignites in south-west

image.altText: Ash Centra holding her Collingwood gurnsey, next to a pair of members of the Collingwood club

props.synopsis: Midfield prodigy Ash Centra headlines the first AFLW national draft, taken as the number one pick by Collingwood.

title.children: 'I didn't believe it': New crop of AFLW talent taken in first national draft

image.altText: A pen full of merino sheep with one looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Australia is a leading wool producer globally, but a new report predicts production will reach its lowest level in more than a century by mid-2025.

title.children: Australian wool production forecast to hit 100-year low

image.altText: Next to a very large, brightly coloured mural painting, a woman with brown hair and wearing art smock, stands holds paintbrush.

props.synopsis:
A Victorian studio for artists with disabilities is celebrating five decades with its first survey exhibition at TarraWarra Museum of Art.

Â

title.children: Artists with intellectual disabilities celebrate 50 years creating together

image.altText: Two sitting figures are seen in silhouette against the ocean and last light of the setting sun.

props.synopsis: Australians on the front line of climate change are fighting to save their vanishing ancestral home. Can a landmark lawsuit against the federal government save their way of life?

title.children: Life on a sinking island on Australia's northern fringe

image.altText: A green electric vehicle parked in an underground charging bay.

props.synopsis: Strata owners are increasingly banning electric vehicles from charging in basement carparks as fire safety authorities disagree over the risk of battery fires.

title.children: EVs in apartment carparks a battleground amid fight over right to charge

image.altText: A photo of Roger Hearn in Gaza standing outside a building with blue arabic writing.

props.synopsis: As director of relief, Roger Hearn was responsible for organising the distribution of food from aid trucks coming in through the border. But what depressed him the most was being unable to bring in enough food to help feed Gaza's 1.9 million internally displaced people.

title.children: Australian aid worker has been to Gaza often, but this visit shook him

image.altText: Moira Deeming appears serious as she walks through the parliament carpark, wearing a purple blazer.

props.synopsis:
A group of Victorian Liberal MPs are a pushing to bring ousted MP Moira Deeming back into the party room following her Federal Court victory against party leader John Pesutto.

Â

title.children: Liberal MPs call for vote on reinstating Moira Deeming to party room

image.altText: Australia captain Pat Cummins grimaces as he walks off in the rain during a Test.

props.synopsis: Frustration was the emotion of the day as Australia's best attempts to take control of the third Test at the Gabba were spoiled time and again by the most annoying rain possible.

title.children: Australia frustrated by rain, the only thing that can save India

image.altText: Donald Trump points as he stands in front of a gold-gilded wall and an American flag.

props.synopsis: In a wide-ranging Q&A with the press in Florida, the president-elect talks about topics ranging from the Middle East to the future of TikTok.

title.children: Five takeaways from Trump's first post-election press conference

image.altText: A picture of a sunny resort in Fiji

props.synopsis: Investigations and toxicology tests are ongoing in Fiji after four Australian women who drank cocktails at a local resort were hospitalised.

title.children: Family holiday becomes 'worst nightmare' after Fiji alcohol poisoning

image.altText: Marked and unmarked police cars on a street

props.synopsis: A shooting at a private Christian school in the US state of Wisconsin leaves three people dead, including a child who caused the attack, according to authorities.Â

title.children: Three dead including shooter in Wisconsin school attack

image.altText: A young woman in a blue shirt smiles

props.synopsis: Doctors have been urged to reconsider prescribing new patients crucial hormone replacement therapy amid a severe shortage that is leaving some women in a "constant state" of anxiety.

title.children: Doctors urged not to start new patients on HRT patches amid severe shortage

image.altText: The corporate logos of Ladbrokes and Neds betting agencies.

props.synopsis: AUSTRAC alleges Entain did not develop and maintain a compliant anti-money laundering program and failed to identify and assess the risks it faced, leaving the company at serious risk of criminal exploitation.Â

title.children: Owner of Ladbrokes and Neds sued for alleged anti-money laundering failure

image.altText: A close-up of solar panels on top of a house

props.synopsis: While Canberra has been locked in a pitched battle over climate and energy for 25 years, Australians have decided to go it alone, attaching solar panels to their roofs.

title.children: Dutton goes nuclear over energy costing assumptions

image.altText: A blue screen with green and red stocks at the Australian Securities Exchange 29.8.21

props.synopsis: The ASX opens higher, looking to end a five-session losing streak. Wall Street resumes its rally. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Nasdaq, bitcoin hit fresh records, ASX edges higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: House prices to cool more before a 2026 recovery: ANZ
Consumer watchdog sinks its fangs into Mobil
ASX 200 gains 0.8%, as banks rise and energy stocks fall

image.altText: Prince Andrew stands outside Westminster Abbey at the thanksgiving service for Prince Philip.

props.synopsis: Yang Tengbo denies he is a spy and says he is a victim of a changing political landscape between the UK and China.Â

title.children: Alleged Chinese spy with links to Prince Andrew named

image.altText: Corporate grey office building and ABC logo

props.synopsis: In addition to increasing funding for the ABC, Labor says it will seek to legislate five-year funding terms for the ABC and SBS to help prevent "political interference".

title.children: Government announces $40m-a-year funding boost for ABC

image.altText: A blonde woman throwing a yellow banana milkshake in the face of Nigel Farage standing in a group of people

props.synopsis: Victoria Thomas Bowen, 25, was seen throwing a large milkshake over the politician during this year's UK election campaign.

title.children: Woman who threw milkshake at Nigel Farage handed jail sentence

image.altText: An image of Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Chen Si-Yi, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj

props.synopsis: The Melbourne pastor who has ministered to the Bali Nine members for many years expresses her gratitude to the Indonesian president for allowing the remaining five men to return to Australia.

title.children: Australian pastor 'relieved' remaining Bali Nine members back in Australia

image.altText: A graphic of a house that is similar to a dolls house with a for sale sign out the front

props.synopsis: Are you affected by the housing crisis in Australia? The issue could be pivotal in next year's federal election and ABC News is asking you to share your housing story.

title.children: We want to hear how Australia's housing crisis has impacted you. Share your story

image.altText: Composite image of India bowler Jasprit Bumrah and cricket commentator Isa Guha.

props.synopsis: Fox Sports commentator Isa Guha says she is "deeply sorry" for a poor choice of words while talking about India bowler Jasprit Bumrah during the third Test at the Gabba.

title.children: Cricket commentator Isa Guha apologises for calling Jasprit Bumrah 'most valuable primate'

image.altText: Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Si-Yi Chen, Martin Stephens standing in a line as legal documents are signed on a table in front

props.synopsis: Ten years ago, Joko Widodo ignored Bali Nine member's clemency pleas. Now, less than two months after taking office, Indonesia's new leader Prabowo Subianto has done pretty much the opposite.

title.children: The remaining Bali Nine members are home due to a secret goodwill mission

image.altText: A former police officer, a 34-year-old male, arriving at the NSW Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: The former police officer who was found guilty of the manslaughter of 95-year-old Clare Nowland is seeking a review of his sacking in the Industrial Relations Commission.

title.children: Kristian White launches court action after losing police job

image.altText: President Bashar al-Assad and President Vladimir Putin shaking hands inside a Kremlin meeting room.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has lost his key anchor of influence in the Middle East with the fall of Bashar al-Assad's regime, but he seemingly knew it was coming and was chatting with new players in the region ahead of his downfall.

title.children: Why did Russia let Syria fall? Experts say it was a calculated risk

image.altText: An illustration of a hand dangling a Bitcoin on a yoyo

props.synopsis: Donald Trump was once a crypto sceptic. Now his re-election has sent the volatile price of Bitcoin sky-high.

title.children: Trump's conversion to crypto fan could mean bad news for the US dollar

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: Economists are concerned that the Reserve Bank's overhaul could risk delaying interest rate relief for millions of mortgage borrowers.

title.children: Economists warn RBA board changes risk delaying interest rate cut

image.altText: Piles of corrugated and sheet metal surrounded by chunks of wood on the ground and stripped structures and trees

props.synopsis: The tropical storm is the worst to hit the French territory of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean in 90 years.

title.children: Cyclone hits Mayotte archipelago killing hundreds, possibly thousands

image.altText: children play with building bricks

props.synopsis: Three Genius Childcare workers take legal action against the company over allegations it intentionally paid wages late and failed to pay them thousands of dollars in superannuation.

title.children: Childcare chaos as workers sue company

image.altText: The sun rises with a plant pictured in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Two Riverina towns reached record December highs on Monday, but several other southern and western NSW towns fell short. It comes as a heatwave sweeps across the country.

title.children: Parts of NSW swelter in record heat, but others fail to reach predictions

image.altText: Screenshot of a Moochies watch for sale online. The watch face shows a woman smiling with 'mum' as the contact being called.

props.synopsis: The company behind Moochies watches is in liquidation, but the devices are still being sold despite mounting complaints of SIM card issues, GPS errors and difficulties contacting the firm for refunds.

title.children: Telco ombudsman concerned 'unwitting parents' buying Moochies watches

image.altText: Nicola, right, looks longingly at Luke, left, who lightly touches her face while outside in the evening.

props.synopsis: Whether it was in enormous blockbusters, anarchic music films or swoony romance, our big screens have been dominated by Irish actors this year. And a deeply embedded cultural respect for the arts could be part of their success.

title.children: Winning Oscars and speaking truth: How Irish actors took over Hollywood
